changedAssets.comment: The service now provides the keyStoreAlias, keyAlias, hostNameVerification, cipherSuites, and checkCRL optional input parameters for enhanced security in HTTP requests.
Added the fields localFileNameEncoding and remoteFileNameEncoding to specify the character set in which the local and remote files, respectively, are encoded.
The document type now includes fields for streaming transportation.

Added the input parameters encodeListsAndSetsAsArrays to indicate if the service encodes instances of java.util.List and java.util.Set as arrays or Strings, and the input parameter encodeMapAsString to specify how the service encodes java.util.Map objects in the document (IData).

Added the returnMimeMessage input parameter to control whether the MIME message is returned as a javax.mail.internet.MimeMessage instead of a java.io.InputStream object when any of the body parts in the message exceed the large data threshold set by the watt.server.mime.largeDataThreshold.
The service now includes the token_label input parameter which is a label to assign to the token. You might use a label to specify the purpose of the token.
The service now deletes the expired tokens in batches. The server configuration parameter watt.server.oauth.token.removal.batchSize determines the batch size
The service now includes input parameters to support JCE encryption.
The service now includes input parameters to support JCE encryption.
The service now includes input parameters to support JCE encryption.
The service now includes input parameters to support JCE encryption.
The service now includes input parameters to support JCE encryption.
The service now includes input parameters to support JCE encryption.
The service now includes the optional prettyPrint input parameter to indicate whether the service performs pretty print formatting for the XML String returned in the xmldata output.

The service now includes the optional treatXsiNilAsNull input parameter to indicate whether Integration Server should consider the xsi:nil attribute of an empty XML tag as null in the resulting XML string.
The smtpSender/secure/useJSSE output parameter has been removed.
The smtpSender/secure/useJSSE input parameter has been removed. All outbound connections use JSSE.
The smtpSender/secure/useJSSE input parameter has been removed. All outbound connections use JSSE.
The useJSSE input parameter has been removed. All outbound connections use JSSE.
The useJSSE input parameter has been removed. All outbound connections use JSSE.
The useJSSE input parameter has been removed. All outbound connections use JSSE.
TThe secure/useJSSE input parameter has been removed. All outbound connections use JSSE.
TThe secure/useJSSE input parameter has been removed. All outbound connections use JSSE.
The service now includes the optional largeFile input parameter that indicates whether the file specified in the input is a large file or not.
The service now includes the optional encodeStringAsBoolean and encodeStringAsNumber input parameters.
Added the optional publicKeyString input parameter and string output parameter. Changed data type of inputs publicKeyBytes to ObjectList and publicKeyAlias to String List.
Added optional secretKeyString and publicKeyString input parameters, and the string output parameter to return the decrypted data as a string when the input to the service is a string.
Added optional secretKeyString input parameter and the string output parameter. Changed data type of inputs publicKeyBytes to ObjectList and publicKeyAlias to String List.
Added optional secretKeyString input parameter and the string output parameter.
Added optional secretKeyString input parameter and the string output parameter. Changed data type of inputs publicKeyBytes to ObjectList and publicKeyAlias to String List.
Added the optional publicKeyString input parameter and string output parameter. Changed data type of inputs publicKeyBytes to ObjectList and publicKeyAlias to String List.
The service no longer supports String Table as resultType.
The service now includes the optional consumptionMode and autoMark input parameters.
The service now includes the consumptionMode and autoMark parameters in the output.

The service now includes the optional consumptionMode and autoMark input parameters. The channelIDs parameter now accepts channel IDs as array elements instead of comma-separated values. The severityCutoff parameter now accepts a severity name instead of the severity cutoff identifier.

The service now lists 13 alert channels instead of 10. The additional alert channels are Metering Log, User Management, and Master Password. Each channel now has two additional parameters: emissionEnabled and systemNotificationEnabled.
The service now includes the optional filter parameters to get the count of a subset of all alerts in the system.

The service now includes the notifierName and filter parameters to get the count of unread alerts for a notifier or a subset of the unread alerts. Both the parameters are optional and can be used independently or together.

The service now includes the optional filter parameters to fetch a subset of all the alerts in the system. The service also includes the sortBy and sortOrder optional input parameters to sort the fetched alerts.
The pub.alert:fetch service from the previous release is renamed to pub.alert:fetchUnread, which now includes the optional notifierName, filter, sortBy and sortOrder input parameters.
The service now includes the description, emissionEnabled, and systemNotificationEnabled output parameters for each channel.
The enabledEmissionChannels and enabledSystemNotifierChannels parameters in the service output display channel IDs as an object list and not as comma-separated values.
The enabledEmissionChannels and enabledSystemNotifierChannels input parameters in the service accept channel IDs as array elements and not as comma-separated values.
The service now includes the followRedirect input parameter to control whether the outbound request follows a redirect when receiving a response code between 300 and 400.

The service includes an additional input parameter encoding that enables you to set the name of a registered IANA character-set that specifies the encoding to use when converting the input string to an array of bytes.
The service now includes the jsonDocumentTypeName and strict input parameters that determine how Integration Server performs the transformation based on a JSON document type.
The service now includes the jsonDocumentTypeName and strict input parameters that determine how Integration Server performs the transformation based on a JSON document type.
The service now includes the jsonDocumentTypeName and strict input parameters that determine how Integration Server performs the transformation based on a JSON document type.
The service now includes code_challenge and code_challenge_method input parameters for use with PKCE.
The service now includes the code_verifier input parameter for use with PKCE.
The service now returns the output parameter removedTokensCount, which indicates the number of expired tokens removed by the service.
The service now includes the dateFormat parameter to specify the date format to use for the date returned by the notBefore and notAfter fields in the validity output parameter.
The service now includes the strictEncodeElements parameter, which controls the behavior of the encode parameter.
The SFTP login service includes additional input parameters that enable you to log in without configuring the SFTP server and user aliases.
The service includes the “useJSSE” field in the “secure” input parameter. To support for OAuth 2.0 the service now includes the “bearer” type in the “auth” field and the “token” field.
The service now includes “OAUTH” and “APIKEY” fields as “type” for the “auth” input parameter. The service also includes the support of the “secure” input parameter and the “trustStoreAlias” field.
The service now includes the support of the “lineSeparator” filed for the “delimiters” input parameter which specifies the character to be used to override the input record delimiter.
The service now includes the encodeDateAs input parameter to specify how java.util.Date instances in the document are encoded in the returned JSON.
The service now includes the unescapeSpecialChars and the decodeNullRootAsEmpty input parameters.
The service now includes the unescapeSpecialChars and the decodeNullRootAsEmpty input parameters.

If the data passed to this service is greater than the threshold set by the server configuration property watt.server.mime.largeDataThreshold, this service  internally stores the content as a temporary file in the Tspace.
The input parameter of this service now also accepts a javax.mail.internet.MimeMessage object.
The specification for MQTT trigger input now includes the topicName field. MQTT triggers can use wildcards to receive messages from multiple topics.
The service now includes the support of ‘useRegex’ parameter which indicates whether Integration Server must support recognizing delimiter character set for 'delim' parameter as regular expressions.
The default value of the Accept header is now controlled by the watt.net.default.accept server configuration parameter. Previously, the default value of the Accept header was: "image/gif, */*"

Adds the input parameter preserveRefs which indicates whether the leading & (ampersand) of a well-formed entity or character reference is left as & or further encoded as & when the data is to be HTML-encoded.
Adds input parameter validateXML which indicates whether the service validates the incoming XML document to ensure it is well-formed XML before converting it to a node.
Adds input parameters cookies, extensions, and subProtocols which are to be parts of the HTTP request used to establish a WebSocket connection.
When sending a JMS message to Universal Messaging, Integration Server sets the JMSMessageID.
When sending a JMS message to Universal Messaging, Integration Server sets the JMSMessageID.
When sending a JMS message to Universal Messaging, Integration Server sets the JMSMessageID.

Supports requests for an access token for the Resource Owner Password Credentials (ROPC) grant type for a public client. Previously, only confidential clients could obtain an access token for the ROPC grant type.

Supports requests for an access token for the Resource Owner Password Credentials (ROPC) grant type for a public client. Previously, only confidential clients could obtain an access token for the ROPC grant type.
A new input parameter trustStore has been added which specifies the alias for the truststore that contains the list of certificates that Integration Server uses to validate the trust relationship.
The multipart MIME messages created by the pub.mime:* services now strip line folding from the header fields.
The multipart MIME messages created by the pub.mime:* services now strip line folding from the header fields.
The multipart MIME messages created by the pub.mime:* services now strip line folding from the header fields.
The multipart MIME messages created by the pub.mime:* services now strip line folding from the header fields.
The multipart MIME messages created by the pub.mime:* services now strip line folding from the header fields.
The multipart MIME messages created by the pub.mime:* services now strip line folding from the header fields.
The multipart MIME messages created by the pub.mime:* services now strip line folding from the header fields.
The multipart MIME messages created by the pub.mime:* services now strip line folding from the header fields.
The multipart MIME messages created by the pub.mime:* services now strip line folding from the header fields.
The multipart MIME messages created by the pub.mime:* services now strip line folding from the header fields.
The multipart MIME messages created by the pub.mime:* services now strip line folding from the header fields.
The multipart MIME messages created by the pub.mime:* services now strip line folding from the header fields.
The multipart MIME messages created by the pub.mime:* services now strip line folding from the header fields.
The service now supports the client credentials grant and the resource owner password credentials grant types.
The service now supports the client credentials grant and the resource owner password credentials grant types.

When the pub.client:http service sends a POST, PUT, DELETE, or PATCH request and receives a 307 or 308 response status code from an HTTP server, the service no longer changes the request method to GET when redirecting.
The uuid field can now be set in the document envelope when publishing a document to Universal Messaging using the pub.publish:publish service. Previously, the uuid field was read-only.
The pub.jms:sendBatch service can now be used with Universal Messaging as the JMS provider.
Integration Server now executes the template file and any services therein, using the credentials of the user who invoked the pub.report* service.
Integration Server now executes the template file and any services therein, using the credentials of the user who invoked the pub.report* service.
Integration Server now executes the template file and any services therein, using the credentials of the user who invoked the pub.report* service.
Integration Server now executes the template file and any services therein, using the credentials of the user who invoked the pub.report* service.
Integration Server now executes the template file and any services therein, using the credentials of the user who invoked the pub.report* service.
Integration Server now executes the template file and any services therein, using the credentials of the user who invoked the pub.report* service.
The inputProcessing\supportDTD input parameter now has a default value of false. The inputProcessing\isSupportingExternalEntities input parameter now has a default value of false.
The inputProcessing\supportDTD input parameter now has a default value of false. The inputProcessing\isSupportingExternalEntities input parameter now has a default value of false
Updated the input parameter secure to include useJSSE as a child parameter.
Updated the input parameter secure to include useJSSE as a child parameter.
You can now supply a value in the data/bytes input variable when the method input variable is DELETE.
Updated the input parameter secure to include useJSSE as a child parameter.
Updated the input parameter secure to include useJSSE as a child parameter.
You can now supply a value in the data/bytes input variable when the method input variable is DELETE.
Added input parameters isDetached, keyName, includeKeyValue. The certData input parameter now includes X509_CRL as an option.

The method input parameter now supports the PATCH method. The auth input parameter now contains a kerberos document in which you can specify jaasContext, clientPrincipal, clientPassword, servicePrincipal, and servicePrincipalForm. If the remote server redirected pub.client:http, encodedURL will contain the URL submitted to the server to which it was redirected.
New input parameters isAsync, service Name, and runAsUser.
Added the JMSMessage/header/replyTo input parameter which can be used to specify a destination for replies without actually needing to wait for replies.
New input parameters dataAsStream and signatureAsStream.
New input parameters signatureAsStream and dataAsStream. New output parameter contentAsStream.
New input parameter inputAsStream. New output parameter outputAsStream
The publishable document type now specifies the IS_LOCAL_CONNECTION alias as the connection alias used to publish and retrieve instances of this document type.
The publishable document type now specifies the IS_LOCAL_CONNECTION alias as the connection alias used to publish and retrieve instances of this document type.
The service can now validate XMLData against an XML document type.

Integration Server now ignores the value of the $close input parameter when a trigger service for a webMethods messaging trigger executes the pub.remote:invoke service, if the watt.server.trigger.reuseSession server configuration parameter is set to true.
The applyChangeAcrossCluster input parameter now applies to webMethods messaging triggers that receive documents from Universal Messaging.
The applyChangeAcrossCluster input parameter now applies to webMethods messaging triggers that receive documents from Universal Messaging.
The applyChangeAcrossCluster input parameter now applies to webMethods messaging triggers that receive documents from Universal Messaging.
The applyChangeAcrossCluster input parameter now applies to webMethods messaging triggers that receive documents from Universal Messaging.
Added useWriter input parameter.

Before writing the pipeline to a file, Integration Server verifies whether the provided path is specified in the allowedWritePaths parameter of the file access control configuration file (fileAccessControl.cnf).
Added the ability to deliver documents with webMethods Universal Messaging.
Added the ability to publish documents with webMethods Universal Messaging.
webMethods Universal Messaging now supports the read-only parameter destID.
Added ignoreBOMChars input parameter.
Added new encode input parameter.
Service can now return transport information for services invoked by webMethods messaging triggers.
Added new messaging field to contain transport information for webMethods messaging triggers.
Added the ability to publish documents to webMethods Universal Messaging.
Added the ability to reply to documents via webMethods Universal Messaging.
Added the ability to wait for reply documents routed through webMethods Universal Messaging.

Service can be used to create webMethods messaging triggers that subscribe to documents routed through webMethods Universal Messaging. Added the new input parameters properties\executeUser and  conditions\messageTypeFilterPairs\providerFilter.

Added new key Digest to the auth\type parameter. If connectTimeout is not specified, Integration Server uses the value of watt.net.timeout server configuration parameter. If no value is specified for watt.net.timeout, server will use the operating system timeout value.
Added new key Digest to the auth\transport\type parameter.
Added new parameters responseString and responseBytes. Deprecated parameters response, string, and bytes.
Both the auth > message input parameter and sequenceKey output parameter were removed.
Removed Google, Facebook, and Twitter as options for the provider parameter. Possible options for the provider parameter are now IntegrationServer and Other.
Added new keys clientIP and clientPort to the HTTP ipInfo parameter.
Added the ability to publish documents to webMethods Universal Messaging.
Added signatureAlgorithm and digestAlgorithm as new input parameters. Possible values for each field are SHA1 (the default), SHA256, SHA384, and SHA512.

Changed type key and added new token key to auth input parameter. You can now specify Basic or Bearer for type. The token key is the access token to submit to the OAuth resource server. It is required only when type is set to "Bearer".
Added isDocumentList as new input parameter and resultsList as new output parameter.
Changed input parameter document to documentBytes.  documentBytes is the array of bytes (byte[]) to convert to a document.
Added evt:EventID, evt:Priority, evt:ProducerID, evt:UserID, evt:CustomHeaders as new input parameters.
The responseCode parameter now accepts any value. If the value is not listed in RFC 2616, Section 10, you must provide a value for the reasonPhrase parameter.
Added decodeHeaders as new input parameter.
Changed hashAlgorithm key. You can now specify MD5, SHA-1, SHA-256, SHA-384, or SHA-512 for hashAlgorithm.
Changed how enveloping signatures are verified.
Added contentModelCompliance as new input parameter.
Added handleRequestService, handleResponseService, and handleFaultService as new output parameters.
Added handleRequestService, handleResponseService, and handleFaultService as new output parameters.
Added error as new output parameter.
Added error as new output parameter.
Added arguments as a new input parameter.
The rootNode input parameter now takes an enhanced XML node as input in addition to a com.wm.lang.xml.Node object.
The node input parameter now takes an enhanced XML node as input in addition to a com.wm.lang.xml.Node object.
The node input parameter now takes an enhanced XML node as input in addition to a com.wm.lang.xml.Node object.
The node input parameter now takes an org.w3c.dom.Node object as input in addition to a com.wm.lang.xml.Node object.
Added loadExternalEntities as a new input parameter.
Added ability to disable output validation through the use of the watt.server.soap.validateResponse configuration property.
Added error as new output parameter.
Added error as new output parameter.
Added expandGeneralEntities as new input parameter.
Added useNamespacesOfDocumentType as new input parameter.
Added expandGeneralEntities as new input parameter.
Added secure as new input parameter.
Added transportHeaders as a new input parameter and added headers/requestLines as a new output parameter.
Added reasonPhrase as new input parameter.
Added support for setting headers in a JMS message that contains a SOAP response.
Added the jms document as a new parameter to contain the JMS protocol information.
Added JMS_WMClusterNodes as a new parameter.
Added JMS_WMClusterNodes as a new output parameter.
Added JMS_WMClusterNodes as a new input and output parameter.

Added JMS_WMClusterNodes as a new input and output parameter. If the reply destination is a temporary queue and useCSQ is set to true, values must be specified for the destinationNameReplyTo and destinationTypeReplyTo input parameters.

Added JMS_WMClusterNodes as a new output parameter. The pub.jms:waitForReply service cannot be used to retrieve response to requests that were routed through the client side queue. To retrieve the response, create a JMS trigger that subscribes to the reply to queue.
Added archiveOnInstall as a new input parameter.
Added validate as new input parameter.
Added validate as new input parameter.
Added generateheaderDocs, generateBodyDoc, generateFaultDocs, and generateXOPObjectForBase64Binary as new input parameters.
Added validate as new input parameter.
Added connectionCount as new input parameter

Changed default behavior when the XML node contains multiple occurrences of an element in an XML node when the makeArrays input parameter is set to false.  Previously the document would contain only the last occurrence of the element. Now, the document will contains multiple occurrences of the element, controlled by the new parameter watt.server.xml.xmlNodeToDocument.keepDuplicates.
Added ability to disable output validation through the use of the watt.server.soap.validateResponse configuration property.
Added error as new output parameter.
Added error as new output parameter.
Added expandGeneralEntities as new input parameter.
Added useNamespacesOfDocumentType as new input parameter.
Output parameter deliveryID is deprecated. Use taskId instead.
Logging data for activations is deprecated, along with input parameters ACTIVATION_DAYS_TO_RETAIN, ACTIVATION_ARCHIVE_ACTION and ACTIVATION_STATUS_CRITERIA.
Added expandGeneralEntities as new input parameter.
Output parameter deliveryID has been deprecated. Use taskId instead.
Input parameter idType is deprecated. Use idTypeDesc instead.
Input parameter idType is deprecated. Use idTypeDesc instead.
Field Content is deprecated. The original content of the document is in the list of ContentParts.
Fields Certificate, CACertificate and PrivateKey are deprecated, Use services in wm.tn.security to retrieve.
PGP-encryption support is deprecated.
